comments.author: bugzilla2007@duellmann24.net
comments.text:
Nitfix:

STR

(on Windows, might be different for other OS, esp. Linux)
1) Help > About TB
2) Click to focus main TB window

Actual

- About TB loses focus
- main TB window receives focus
- no way to re-focus About TB window using keyboard, keyboard-inaccessible, cannot close the dialogue using keyboard only

Expected
- About TB dialogue window should be truly modal
- don't allow focusing main window while we show About (always in foreground)
- so as long as About is shown (always in foreground), it has focus, and can be accessed/closed via keyboard.

We should decide what we want:
- if we want *two* focusable windows (main window + about window), then both of them must be on window list (plus bug 528029), to be fully keyboard-accessible.
- if we don't want About to be in the window list as a separate window (like in current trunk), then make it *truly* application-modal. There is absolutely no point of letting the user focus main window while we are showing About in the foreground.

comments.author: vseerror@lehigh.edu
comments.text: Is this still an accessibility issue?
comments.creator: vseerror@lehigh.edu
comments.raw_text: Is this still an accessibility issue?

comments.creator: bugzilla2007@duellmann24.net
comments.text:
(In reply to Wayne Mery (:wsmwk) from comment #1)
> Is this still an accessibility issue?

This bug does not create challenges for keyboard-only users, so it's not an access problem in the strict sense. You need one mouse click to get into the inaccessible state, which is then inconvenient for keyboard-affine users. It's definitely wrong design because there's not much you can reasonably do with any Thunderbird window as long as About dialog is in the way. Also on Window manager we misrepresent the window as if the About dialog would not exist. Any small dialog is app-modal, not sure why the big one shouldn't be.
